intro: Rhopalopilia altescandens, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
